projectDesc.p: "Outside of Rome" is published by The Global Medieval Sourcebook (GMS), a free, open access, and open source compendium of medieval texts in their original languages and in English translation. GMS comprises computer-readable transcriptions or editions alongside new translations of texts dating from the ninth to the sixteenth century and originating in Europe, North Africa, the Middle East, and Asia. The GMS platform includes critical introductions as well as sources for further reading.

editorialDecl.p: Transcriptions and translations are encoded in XML conforming to TEI (P5) guidelines. The original-language text is contained within <lem> tags and translations within <rdg> tags.

interpretation.p: Texts are translated into modern American English with maximum fidelity to the original text, except where it would impair comprehension or good style. Archaisms are preserved where they do not conflict with the aesthetic of the original text. Scribal errors and creative translation choices are marked and discussed in the critical notes.
The text has been punctuated. Word separation and capitalization follow modern usage.

app.lem: fuera del monte, en una grand plana,
app.rdg: Out of the woods, in a large plain,

app.lem: a muy grandes saltos uenia la serrana.
app.rdg: The mountain woman came [to me] in big leaps.

app.lem: Vestida muy corta de panno de eruage,
app.rdg: Dressed in a short coarse woolen cloth,
Her gray hair she had sheared,

app.lem: las piernas pelosas bien como saluage,
app.rdg: Her legs were hairy like those of a savage,

app.lem: los dientes muy luengos, la fruente arrugada;
app.rdg: Her teeth were very long, her forehead was wrinkled,

app.lem: las tetas disformes atras las lançaua,
app.rdg: Her deformed tits were swinging backwards,
Bald, unibrow, with such a big nose,

app.lem: tuerta de un oio, ynbifia, barbuda,
app.rdg: Blind in one eye, hunchbacked, bearded,

app.lem: galindos los pies que diablo semblaua.
app.rdg: Her feet all twisted, she looked like a devil.
